Title: "Monitoring and Alerting for Azure Search Indexer and Skillset"
Text:
C:\Users\adamh\Downloads\azure-search.pdfMetricNameDescriptionDimensionsSample use casesDocumentprocessedcountShows thenumber ofindexerprocesseddocuments.Data source name,failed, index name,indexer name, skillsetname- Can be referenced as a rough measure ofthroughput (number of documentsprocessed by indexer over time)  - Set up to alert on failed documentsSkillexecutioninvocationcountShows thenumber ofskillinvocations.
Data source name,failed, index name,indexer name, skillname, skill type,skillset name- Reference to ensure skills are invoked asexpected by comparing relative invocationnumbers between skills and number of skillinvocations to the number of documents.  - Set up to alert on failed skill invocationsThe screenshot below shows the number of documents processed by indexers within aservice over an hour, split up by indexer name.You can also configure the graph to see the number of skill invocations over the samehour interval.
You can retrieve the status and execution history of an indexer using the Get IndexerStatus command:HTTPThe response contains overall indexer status, the last (or in-progress) indexer invocation,and the history of recent indexer invocations.OutputMonitor using Get Indexer Status (REST API)GET https://[service name].
search.windows.net/indexers/[indexer name]/status?api-version=2020-06-30 api-key: [Search service admin key] {     "status":"running",     "lastResult": {         "status":"success",         "errorMessage":null,         "startTime":"2018-11-26T03:37:18.853Z",         "endTime":"2018-11-26T03:37:19. 012Z",         "errors":[],         "itemsProcessed":11,         "itemsFailed":0,         "initialTrackingState":null,         "finalTrackingState":null     },     "executionHistory":[ {         "status":"success",          "errorMessage":null,         "startTime":"2018-11-26T03:37:18.853Z",         "endTime":"2018-11-26T03:37:19.
